name: SANS LAB 5.5 - Emulation vs Detection Story

agents.name: List records with a filter
agents.description:
Retrieve a list of record results.

Link to documentation: https://www.tines.com/api/records/list

local.final_payload:
=REJECT(
  LOCAL.optional_parameters,
  LAMBDA(
    item,
    OR(
      item = NULL,
      IF(
        OR(
          TYPE(item) = "TrueClass",
          TYPE(item) = "FalseClass",
          TYPE(item) = "Integer"
        ),
        IS_EMPTY(TEXT(item)),
        IS_EMPTY(item)
      )
    )
  )
)

agents.name: HTTP Request Action - Create Adversary Profile

options.guidance:
The abilities that linked to APT-28 and are matching technique T1018, T1053, T1012, T1566.001, T1047 and T1003. Only add 2 abilities per technique ID.

Get their ability id so and list all the technique IDs 
Generate an array with the atomic ordering with the ability ids values
Transform the  input into a markdown table

agents.name: Wait for operation
agents.description: Wait 10 minutes before we have all the alerts

options.guidance: Transform the  input into a markdown table
options.script:
def main(input):
    rows = []
    for event in input:
        row = [
            event.get('Story name'),
            event.get('Timestamp'),
            event.get('Detection Title'),
            event.get('Level'),
            event.get('Description Rule'),
            event.get('Command'),
            event.get('Event Type'),
            event.get('Device IP'),
            ', '.join(event.get('MITRE Tactic', [])),
            ', '.join(event.get('MITRE Techniques', [])),
            event.get('Generate Time'),
            event.get('User'),
            str(event.get('id'))
        ]
        rows.append(row)

    table = '| Story name | Timestamp | Detection Title | Level | Description Rule | Command | Event Type | Device IP | MITRE Tactic | MITRE Techniques | Generate Time | User | id |\n'
    table += '| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n'
    for row in rows:
        table += '| ' + ' | '.join(map(str, row)) + ' |\n'

    return table

agents.name: Update a case
agents.description:
Update a case in Tines.

Link to documentation: https://www.tines.com/api/cases/update

local.final_payload:
=REJECT(
  LOCAL.optional_parameters,
  LAMBDA(
    item,
    OR(
      item = NULL,
      IF(
        OR(
          TYPE(item) = "TrueClass",
          TYPE(item) = "FalseClass",
          TYPE(item) = "Integer"
        ),
        IS_EMPTY(TEXT(item)),
        IS_EMPTY(item)
      )
    )
  )
)

options.guidance: Transform the  input into a markdown table with title technique ID and technique name. If it is a null, then output \"detected is none\".
Transform the  input into a markdown table with title technique ID and technique name

diagram_notes.content:
# Detection Flow - Lima Charlie 
This flow establishes a webhook that will receive events from Lima Charlie and analyses the results.

A webhook is litsening on incoming alerts

# Emulation flow: Run Adversary

Run your campaign in Caldera

# Creating a case for our campaign
Within tines we now can create a case that our operation is running and add some evidences. 

When the operation is completly finished we can have a look at the detection records and match the executed techniques vs the detected techniques

The results from this API call are appended to an array managed by the `Merge Results` Action. If the array does not exist, it will be created automatically.

Each time around this loop, more results will be appended to the same array.

action_inputs.name: Tenant domain
action_inputs.description: The domain of the tenant.

action_inputs.name: Range start
action_inputs.description: The start time for the time range of record results.

action_inputs.name: Range end
action_inputs.description: The end time for the time range of record results.

action_inputs.name: Record type ID
action_inputs.description: The ID of the record result to retrieve. Identify the record ID using the INFO key. Optional if record field IDs are specified.

action_inputs.name: Page
action_inputs.description: The page number of results to fetch. Relevant for queries with multiple pages of results

action_inputs.name: Per page
action_inputs.description: Set the number of record results returned per page. Defaults to 20, maximum is 500.

action_inputs.name: Order field ID
action_inputs.description: The ID of the field used to order the record results (order specified by 'sort direction order' parameter). Identify the field ID using the INFO key.

action_inputs.name: Sort direction order
action_inputs.description: Sorts the list in ascending or descending order. Defaults to descending. Identify the ID to sort by in the 'order field ID' parameter.

action_inputs.name: Story IDs
action_inputs.description: Comma separated list of story IDs to filter the results.

action_inputs.name: Record field IDs
action_inputs.description: Comma separated list of record field IDs to filter the results. Identify the record field ID using the INFO key. Optional if record type ID is specified.

action_inputs.name: Filters
action_inputs.description: Add as many filters as desired as an object with the field_id, operator, and value specified.

action_inputs.name: Test mode
action_inputs.description: Select 'yes' to filter by records created in 'test' mode for stories with change control. Defaults to 'no'.

action_inputs.name: Tenant domain
action_inputs.description: The domain of the tenant.

action_inputs.name: Case ID
action_inputs.description: ID of case to update.

action_inputs.name: Case status
action_inputs.description: The case status - open or closed.

action_inputs.name: Case priority
action_inputs.description: The case priority.

action_inputs.name: Author email
action_inputs.description: The email of the user creating the cases.

action_inputs.name: Opened at
action_inputs.description: Timestamp representing the date and time the case was opened at.

action_inputs.name: Resolved at
action_inputs.description: Timestamp representing the date and time the case was resolved at.

action_inputs.name: Case name
action_inputs.description: The name of the case.

action_inputs.name: Add assignee emails
action_inputs.description: A comma separated list of user email addresses to assign  the case.

action_inputs.name: Remove assignee emails
action_inputs.description: A comma separated list of user email addresses to remove from the case.

action_inputs.name: Add tags
action_inputs.description: A comma separated list of tags to add to the case.

action_inputs.name: Remove tags
action_inputs.description: A comma separated list of tags to remove from the case.

action_inputs.name: Closure conditions
action_inputs.description: An array of closure requirements in the form of a set of formula rules that need to evaluate to true to enable the closing of a case. Ex: `[{"name":"User assigned", "formula":"\\=SIZE(team_case.assignees) > 0"}]`

action_inputs.name: Sub status ID
action_inputs.description: The case sub-status ID

action_inputs.name: Description
action_inputs.description: The case description. Follows [markdown formatting](https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/).
action_inputs.value:
"# Detected Techiques Techniques
<<transform_vs_table_to_markdown.output>>

# Undetected Techniques 
<<transform_undetected_table_to_markdown.output>>





# All Techniques executed

<<transform_to_table.output>>

# All Detections triggered

<<transform_to_markdown.output>>"
